labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Pote" is primarily focused on providing comprehensive information about dog breeds. It offers tools to retrieve lists of breeds, detailed descriptions of each breed, and even access to dog-related posts/ads for specific breeds. The server acts as a specialized knowledge base and directory for dog breed information, making it useful for pet owners, breeders, researchers, or anyone interested in canine breeding.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Content Creation" is chosen because the server generates and provides curated wiki-style content about dog breeds, which fits the definition of content creation and management. Secondary labels include "Web Search & Research" due to its directory-like structure for breed information, and "Daily Productivity" for users who might use this as a reference tool for pet-related tasks. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently describe the functionality.

tools.name: get-all-breeds
tools.description: Get a list of all supported dog breeds and their IDs

includeImage.description: Whether to include cover images in the response

tools.name: get-breed-info
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific dog breed by ID

breedId.description: The ID of the dog breed

tools.name: get-breed-posts
tools.description: Get a list of available dog posts/ads for a specific breed.

breedId.description: The ID of the dog breed

limit.description: Maximum number of posts to return

tools.name: get-post-by-id
tools.description: Get more detailed information about a specific post by providing the ID of the post in the database. The ID should be found in the list of posts returned by the get-breed-posts tool. It's a mongodb id.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@BarkApp/pote-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
